quizzes.title: History Quiz: Athens and Age
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, patron, death. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Socrates started the first true school of philosophy.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: The Boer Wars were fought by the British Empire against which colonists?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dutch in South Africa

questions.question: She was Miss Moneypenny in 14 of the James Bond films.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lois Maxwell

questions.question: Which wars are known as Reconquista?

options.text: The conquering of todays Latin America by Spain and Portugal
The war between US and Mexico in the beginning of the XIX century
The colonization of the Indian Peninsula by Portuguese, Dutch and later British colonists
The expansion of Christian kingdoms at the expense of Muslim states on the Iberian Peninsula

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The expansion of Christian kingdoms at the expense of Muslim states on the Iberian Peninsula

questions.question: He was 69 at the time of his death in April 2007. He sang Monster Mash. You remember, it was a graveyard smash.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Boris Pickett

questions.question: Against which of the following were the medieval Crusades fought?

options.text: Against Jewish communities across Europe only
Against Moors on the Iberian Peninsula only
Against Turks in the Holy Land only
Against anybody the Pope would declare an enemy

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Against anybody the Pope would declare an enemy

questions.question: What was the name of the famous market place in Athens?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Agora

questions.question: This singer, who sang the theme song for Rawhide, died on 6th February 2007 at the age of 93.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Frankie Laine

questions.question: Were was the First Turkish-Portuguese War fought in 1509?

options.text: On Cyprus and other islands of the Mediterranean

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: In the Indian Ocean

questions.question: She was Esmeralda on Bewitched.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Alice Ghostley

questions.question: Name the author of Slaughterhouse-Five who died April 11th 2007 at the age of 84.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kurt Vonnegut

questions.question: During which war did the Battle of Marathon take place?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Persian

questions.question: Who was the patron of Athens during its Golden Age?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pericles

questions.question: The Golden age of Athens occurred between which two wars?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Persian and Peloponnesian

questions.question: After the 80 Years War (XVI-XVII century) a new colonial power was born in Europe. Which one?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Netherlands

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Invasion and Countries
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, kind, june. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What kind of government did Athens have during the Golden Age?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Direct Democracy

questions.question: WW II broke out in 1939 with the German invasion of Poland. What month did this invasion take place?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: September

questions.question: What was the name of the political liberalization in Czechoslovakia, which started on January 5 and lasted until August 20, 1968?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Prague Spring

questions.question: Which playwright of Ancient Greece is generally regarded as the father of drama?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Aeschylus

questions.question: Which one of these countries was not one of the Allies during WW II?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Italy

questions.question: Which of these countries was not part of the Warsaw Pact of 1955 ?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yugoslavia

questions.question: The Autumn of Nations is the series of events in Central and Eastern Europe in the autumn of 1989, when the communist regime in satellite states of the Soviet Union, collapsed within a  few months, marking the end of the Cold War.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Operation Barbarossa, which began on June 22, 1941, was the code name of the German invasion of which country?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: the Soviet Union

questions.question: Hippocrates was known as the father of history.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Who was the Soviet General Secretary during the Cuban Missile Crisis in October 1962?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nikita Khrushchev

questions.question: During the period of the Cold War, there was a conflict between the Democratic Republic of Vietnam and Republic of Vietnam, known as The Vietnam War (1957–1975).
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Which of the following was NOT an order of Greek column?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ostrakon

questions.question: The North African Campaign, also known as The Desert War, began in 1940. It included campaigns fought in several African countries. Which of the following was not one of the locations of the North African Campaign?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: South Africa

questions.question: This was a 1961 United States-planned and funded landing, which aimed at overthrowing the government of Fidel Castro, marked the climax of anti-Cuban US actions during  the Cold War. What was the name of this invasion?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Bay of Pigs invasion

questions.question: The Soviet war in Afghanistan which started in 1979, continued for how many years?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 9 years

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Man and Bomb
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, leader, mean. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: On 6 August 1945 the B-29 Enolo Gay, piloted by Colonel Paul Tibet, dropped an atomic bomb on Hiroshima, effectively destroying it. What was that bomb called?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Little Boy

questions.question: When did the United States enter World War II?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1941

questions.question: What term is generally used to describe the genocide of approximately six million European Jews during World War II?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: the Holocaust

questions.question: This man won battles in Greece, Africa, and the Middle East.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Both

questions.question: This man invaded modern day Great Britain.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Julius Caesar

questions.question: What does the German word Blitzkrieg mean?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: lightning war

questions.question: This man conquered modern day Afghanistan and modern day France.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Neither

questions.question: This mans name is linked to a common medical procedure.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Julius Caesar

questions.question: This man is famous for the quote, I came, I saw, I conquered.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Julius Caesar

questions.question: This mans biological son became famous after his death.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Neither

questions.question: According to statistics, approximately how many people lost their lives in World War II?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 62 million

questions.question: In 1945, Churchill, Stalin and Roosevelt made arrangements for post-war Europe. Where did the conference take place?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yalta

questions.question: One of the months of the year is named after this man.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Julius Caesar

questions.question: This man became the leader of his country at the age of 20.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Alexander the Great

questions.question: This man visited the other mans tomb.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Julius Caesar

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Warrior and Normandy
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, leader, actor. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Mulberry was the code name for two artificial harbors built in sections and towed across the English Channel to provide a place for supplies to be landed at Normandy for the invading troops. They were very useful at first but their usefulness was greatly reduced after about two weeks when the following occurred.

options.text: The Allies captured the port at Brest and no longer needed the Mulberries.
A violent storm heavily damaged the Mulberries.
The wear and tear of constant use made the Mulberries deteriorate greatly.
The German air force successfully staged a massive bombing raid on the Mulberries.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A violent storm heavily damaged the Mulberries.

questions.question: The US, Britain and Germany were the main belligerents at Normandy during WWII, but three other nations had troops there who fought in their own organized national units. Which of the following was NOT one of those three nations?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Japan

questions.question: One of historys most daring and able naval commanders, this admiral signaled his fleet at the Battle of Trafalgar by a flag that read England expects that every man will do his duty . What naval commander gave the supreme sacrifice at the Battle of Trafalgar while defeating the navies of the French and Spanish?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Horatio Nelson

questions.question: To aid the Normandy invasion Stalin, the Soviet leader, agreed to do the following.

options.text: Have his air force carry out numerous air attacks on targets in Germany during the Normandy invasion
Send Soviet troops to Britain to act as a reserve if needed
Launch an attack on the eastern front to keep the Germans from moving troops from the East to the western front
Release all prisoners from East European nations who wished to join the Allies at Normandy

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Launch an attack on the eastern front to keep the Germans from moving troops from the East to the western front

questions.question: This man was portrayed by British actor Rex Harrison in the1963 movie Cleopatra.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Julius Caesar

questions.question: What Chinese warrior and strategist wrote The Art of War?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sun Tzu

questions.question: He was the bravest and strongest Greek warrior in the Trojan War. He died when Apollo helped guide Pariss arrow to this warrior only vulnerable spot?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Achilles

questions.question: What Soviet General and Hero of the Soviet Union led the Red Army during the Battle of Stalingrad and the Battle of Kursk?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Marshal Georgy Zhukov

questions.question: Stormd at with shot and shell,
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lord Cardigan

questions.question: During WWII, American troops assaulted two beaches at Normandy. Three other beaches with code names Gold, Sword and Juno were assaulted by troops who mostly came from these two nations.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Britain and Canada

questions.question: What warrior king and his 300 Spartans held back the Persian army for two days in one of historys most heroic last stands?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Leonidas

questions.question: Perhaps the greatest  warrior-king in Roman history, what warrior summed up his victory in these three words, Veni, Vidi, Vici. ?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Julius Caesar

questions.question: Which U.S. state saw the bloodiest fighting of the Civil War?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Virginia

questions.question: Which American Indian tribe was predominantly located in North Georgia?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cherokee

questions.question: It was in a dream before the Battle of Milvian Bridge that a vision of God appeared to this Roman warrior. The vision was followed by the words In this sign shall thou conquer.  What leader, after having a Christian monograph painted on the shields of his army, defeated Maxentius and reunited the Eastern and Western Roman Empire?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Constantine the Great

quizzes.title: History Quiz: China and State
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, electrocution, surabachi. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The American Flag was raised on Mount Surabachi on Iwo Jima in 1944.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: On 18 June 618, Gaozu took the throne, established the Tang Dynasty and opened a new age of prosperity. During the Tang Dynasty, this religion became predominant in China.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Buddhism

questions.question: The Yuan Dynasty was the first foreign dynasty to rule over all of China. It was officially established by this Mongolian ruler in 1271 and ruled over China until 1368.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kublai Khan

questions.question: This Silk Road  dynasty succeeded the Qin Dynasty.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Han Dynasty

questions.question: Which German-American physicist is credited for advising U.S. President Franklin Roosevelt to start the development of an atomic bomb?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Albert Einstein

questions.question: Benjamin Franklin was almost killed by electrocution.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Which of these is one of the reasons why the United States entered World War I?

options.text: Germany tried to persuade Mexico to enter the war.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Germany tried to persuade Mexico to enter the war.

questions.question: Under whose administration did the United States send large numbers of troops to Vietnam?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lyndon Johnson

questions.question: The Song Dynasty (960-1279) ruled over all of the territories of China.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: In 221 BC Zheng of the Qin Dynasty defeated the last independent Chinese state, the State of Qi, and thus unified China. The same year he named himself Shi Huangdi, which means this.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: First Emperor

questions.question: What U.S. President gave a speech beginning with the phrase Four score and seven years ago?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Abraham Lincoln

questions.question: The Qin Dynasty was the first dynasty to embrace Confucianism.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: The Ming Dynasty established the Forbidden City in Beijing. Do you know what ming means in Chinese?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: bright

questions.question: From 1847 to 1923, there were eight U. S. Presidents hailing from this state.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ohio

questions.question: The name of the first capital of the Empire, near which the tomb of the first Chinese emperor- Qin Shi Huang had been built.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Xianyang

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Flop and Cast
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, massachusetts, sermon. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The Forbidden City, lying at the center of Beijing, was the imperial palace during the Ming and Qing Dynasties. Yellow was the symbol of the royal family so the roofs, the decorations and even the bricks on the ground in the Forbidden city are yellow. But there is one exception- the roof of the royal library. What color is it?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: black

questions.question: Steve Bochco had many successes on TV. However, this 1990 ABC police drama, that also featured the cast breaking out in song, was a failure.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cop Rock

questions.question: In 1985 New Coke was introduced. For many reasons it  was a great flop and the company went back to regular coke. How was New Coke different from regular coke?

options.text: It had more lime and less lemon.
It was enriched with vitamins A,C, and D.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It was sweeter.

questions.question: Who gave the sermon at President Lincolns funeral?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dr. Phineas D. Gurley

questions.question: How many civilians were killed in the Battle of Gettysburg?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1

questions.question: The Qing Dynasty was the last  imperial dynasty of China. As a result of the 1911 revolution, a new Republic of China was established  and this is what happened to the last Chinese emperor, Hsuan Tung.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He abdicated

questions.question: What state has the most soldiers buried at the Gettysburg National Cemetery?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: New York

questions.question: This Broadway show with a book and lyrics by Ira Levin opened in 1965 after 11 previews and much rewriting. It starred Lesley Ann warren, Elliot Gould, Beth Howland, and Charles Durning. What was the name of this Victorian melodrama?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Drat! The Cat!

questions.question: Ulysses S. Grants wife, Julia Dent Grant, had a cousin who was a CSA General. What was his name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: James Longstreet

questions.question: This 2003 movie won seven Razzies. It had an all-star cast that included Al Pacino, Lainie Kazan, Christopher Walken and a very hot couple. What is the name of this flop directed and written by Martin Brest?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gigli

questions.question: Gary Marshall has had many big hits on TV and in the movies. However, in 1972 he directed and produced this big flop.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Me and the Chimp

questions.question: It was a 1995 movie about a female pirate, played by Geena Davis, who races other pirates to find hidden  gold. It starred Frank Langella, Mathew Modine, Maury Chaykin and Stan Shaw.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cutthroat Island

questions.question: The commander of the Unions 24th Massachusetts Colored Infantry was Colonel Robert Gould Shaw.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: How long did the Battle of Gettysburg last?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 3 days

questions.question: It could not miss. It was directed by the great Elaine May. It featured Charles Grodin, Isabelle Adjani, Tess Harper, Carol Kane, Jack Weston, and, oh yes, Dustin Hoffman and Warren Beatty. It was a total flop. What was the name of this comedy?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ishtar
